card.name: Abomination
card.ability: Whenever Abomination blocks or becomes blocked by a green or white creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color of the blocking/blocked creature is checked only at declaration of the block. If the creature is indeed green or white at that time, it will be destroyed at the end of the combat even if it changes color before the combat ends.

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

card.name: Alabaster Potion
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains X life; or prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor:
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."
—D'Avenant proverb

card.name: Aladdin's Lamp
card.ability: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you use more than one Lamp effect, the second one will end up replacing the card being drawn with the first one.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.ability: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: ‘It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'"The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Ali Baba
card.ability: {R}: Tap target Wall.
card.flavor:
"When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, ‘Open, Sesame'"
—The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability may be used to tap more than one Wall per turn if you have enough mana, since tapping isn’t part of the activation cost.
10/4/2004 : The ability may tap walls even when Ali Baba is tapped or just entered the battlefield, since the activation cost doesn't include {T}.

card.name: Amrou Kithkin
card.ability: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
card.flavor: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A creature with power 3 or greater can't be declared as a blocker for Amrou Kithkin. If the power of a creature that's already blocking Amrou Kithkin is increased to 3 or greater, it will continue to block Amrou Kithkin.

card.name: Amulet of Kroog
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.

card.name: Angry Mob
card.ability:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

card.name: Animate Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that's already a creature, it won't change its power and toughness.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Animate Dead
card.ability:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When putting a card onto the battlefield that requires a definition for its value or some other choice, you do what is needed to define the value or make the choice.
9/16/2007 : This is a new wording. Animate Dead is now an Aura. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to that card again (since the card is treated as a new object on the battlefield).
9/16/2007 : Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.
4/1/2008 : If the creature card put onto the battlefield has Protection from Black (or anything that prevents this from legally being attached), this won’t be able to attach to it. Then this will go to the graveyard as a State-Based Action, causing the creature to be sacrificed.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Animate Wall
card.ability:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.
card.ruling: 9/16/2007 : This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

card.name: Ankh of Mishra
card.ability: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
10/4/2004 : It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

card.name: Apprentice Wizard
card.ability: {U}, {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

card.name: Armageddon
card.ability: Destroy all lands.

card.name: Armageddon Clock
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Players can remove as many counters as they can pay for each turn.

card.name: Ashes to Ashes
card.ability: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : If one of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it still exiles the other one and deals 5 damage to you.
10/1/2009 : If both of the targeted creatures are illegal targets by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it's countered. It doesn't deal 5 damage to you.

card.name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.
card.flavor: This invention shows why Ashnod was feared by her troops as well as her foes.

card.name: Aspect of Wolf
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

card.name: Backfire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to you, Backfire deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

card.name: Bad Moon
card.ability: Black creatures get +1/+1.

card.name: Balance
card.ability: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This spell is not targeted, so cards which can't be targeted, such as a creature with Protection from White, are both counted and valid choices for being sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : All cards sacrificed at one time go to the graveyard simultaneously. All cards discarded go to the graveyard simultaneously. As always, you pick the order they end up in the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : Cards are not counted until the appropriate step. So, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not count for the last part.

card.name: Ball Lightning
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

card.name: Battering Ram
card.ability:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
card.flavor: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Benalish Hero
card.ability: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Bird Maiden
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
Four things that never meet do here unite
To shed my blood and to ravage my heart,
A radiant brow and tresses that beguile
And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Birds of Paradise
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Black Knight
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
card.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

card.name: Black Mana Battery
card.ability:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Black Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Black Mana Battery: Add {B} to your mana pool, then add an additional {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

card.name: Black Vise
card.ability:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose one opposing player as it enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if Black Vise changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if that player leaves the game.
10/1/2009 : If the chosen player has four or fewer cards in his or her hand as Black Vise's ability resolves, the ability just won't do anything that turn.

card.name: Black Ward
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black. This effect doesn't remove Black Ward.

card.name: Blessing
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Blight
card.ability:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

card.name: Blood Lust
card.ability: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.
card.ruling: 11/1/2005 : Has changed slightly in functionality, with the old continuous nature of the toughness reduction gone away; the toughness change remains static.  For example, if you have three Swamps and Nightmare on the battlefield and then cast Blood Lust on it, it will become 7/1.  If one of your Swamps is subsequently destroyed, your Nightmare will become 6/0 and be put in the graveyard.

card.name: Blue Elemental Blast
card.ability: Choose one — Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

card.name: Blue Mana Battery
card.ability:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Blue Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Blue Mana Battery: Add {U} to your mana pool, then add an additional {U} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

card.name: Blue Ward
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from blue. This effect doesn't remove Blue Ward.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

card.name: Bottle of Suleiman
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

card.name: Brainwash
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.
card.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability is paid for during the declare attackers step of the combat phase.
10/4/2004 : If there are multiple combat phases during the turn, the attack cost must be paid each time if you want to attack with the creature.
10/4/2004 : Paying this cost is not an Instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.

card.name: Brass Man
card.ability:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep.  You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

card.name: Bronze Tablet
card.ability:
Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Bronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped.
{4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If he or she does, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If using a copy of the Tablet, you must trade the copy card to your opponent just like you would have traded the Tablet.
10/4/2004 : You can't choose to pay 10 life if you have less than 10 life, but you may choose to give up the game immediately. This has roughly the same effect.
10/4/2004 : You can take control of your opponent's Tablet and in the trade you only have to give them back their Tablet.
10/4/2004 : If the card being targeted by the Bronze Tablet is removed before Tablet takes effect, then the Tablet ability is countered and it remains tapped.
8/1/2008 : If the tablet is not still on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it is not exiled. The other player still has the choice to pay 10 life, and you still become the owner of their card if they choose not to do so.

card.name: Brothers of Fire
card.ability: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.

card.name: Burrowing
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has mountainwalk.

card.name: Carnivorous Plant
card.ability: Defender
card.flavor:
"It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion."
—Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Carrion Ants
card.ability: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "War is no picnic," my father liked to say. But the Ants seemed to disagree.

card.name: Castle
card.ability: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

card.name: Cave People
card.ability:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn.

card.name: Celestial Prism
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Channel
card.ability: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't pay life you don't have. In other words, you can't Channel yourself below zero life.

card.name: Chaoslace
card.ability: Target spell or permanent becomes red. (Its mana symbols remain unchanged.)

card.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
card.ability: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Black
card.ability: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
card.ability: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Green
card.ability: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Red
card.ability: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: White
card.ability: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Clay Statue
card.ability: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
card.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

card.name: Clockwork Avian
card.ability:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
10/4/2004 : Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
10/4/2004 : If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

card.name: Clockwork Beast
card.ability:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
10/4/2004 : Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
9/16/2007 : This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.
9/16/2007 : If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
9/16/2007 : Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

card.name: Cockatrice
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

card.name: Colossus of Sardia
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.flavor:
From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom:
Warrior born from a rocky womb.
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

card.name: Conservator
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

card.name: Control Magic
card.ability:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You take control of a creature, but Auras enchanting and Equipment attached to the creature do not change controller.

card.name: Conversion
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

card.name: Coral Helm
card.ability: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Cosmic Horror
card.ability:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Cosmic Horror unless you pay {3}{B}{B}{B}. If Cosmic Horror is destroyed this way, it deals 7 damage to you.
card.flavor: ". . . Screams of horror rend th' affrighted skies."Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If you choose not to pay Cosmic Horror's upkeep cost, it deals 7 damage to you only if it's actually destroyed. If it regenerates or an effect has made it indestructible, it deals no damage.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Craw Wurm
card.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

card.name: Creature Bond
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.

card.name: Crimson Manticore
card.ability:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Manticores can be fearsome allies.As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

card.name: Crumble
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

card.name: Crusade
card.ability: White creatures get +1/+1.

card.name: Crystal Rod
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Cursed Land
card.ability:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

card.name: Cursed Rack
card.ability:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.
card.flavor: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The effect of lowering the maximum hand size makes it so the player discards down to 4 cards (instead of the usual 7) during the cleanup step.
10/4/2004 : You choose one opposing player just as this card is entering the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.
10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then a player puts Cursed Rack onto the battlefield choosing you, your maximum hand size will be four. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

card.name: Cyclopean Mummy
card.ability: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.
card.flavor: The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The Mummy does go to the graveyard and trigger abilities which watch for something going to the graveyard. It then gets exiled as a triggered ability.
10/4/2004 : It does not get exiled if it goes to the graveyard from someplace other than the battlefield. This includes discarding from your hand or if the spell is countered.

card.name: Dancing Scimitar
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Death Ward
card.ability: Regenerate target creature.

card.name: Deathgrip
card.ability: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

card.name: Deathlace
card.ability: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

card.name: Desert Twister
card.ability: Destroy target permanent.

card.name: Detonate
card.ability: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

card.name: Diabolic Machine
card.ability: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
card.flavor:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

card.name: Dingus Egg
card.ability: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Disintegrate
card.ability: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
10/4/2004 : Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

card.name: Disrupting Scepter
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can use it on yourself.

card.name: Divine Transformation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
card.flavor: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

card.name: Dragon Engine
card.ability: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

card.name: Dragon Whelp
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: "O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."Marianne Moore, "O to Be a Dragon"
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The first three times Dragon Whelp's ability is activated in a turn will do nothing other than give it +1/+0 until end of turn. Any subsequent activations will also cause its delayed triggered ability to trigger. That means if you activate Dragon Whelp's ability five times, for example, two different delayed triggered abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step and cause you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp.
10/1/2009 : If the fourth (or more) time Dragon Whelp's ability is activated during the same turn happens to be during that turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. You'll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

card.name: Drain Life
card.ability:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
10/4/2004 : You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

card.name: Drain Power
card.ability: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land he or she controls has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
10/4/2004 : Since this is a Sorcery, your opponent may use Instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
10/4/2004 : If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that doesn't target and could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

card.name: Drudge Skeletons
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

card.name: Durkwood Boars
card.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

card.name: Dwarven Warriors
card.ability: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability can be activated after a creature is blocked, but it has no effect. Once a creature is blocked, it can't be unblocked.
10/4/2004 : If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it will still be unblockable that turn.

card.name: Earth Elemental
card.flavor: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

card.name: Earthquake
card.ability: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Ebony Horse
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Elder Land Wurm
card.ability:
Defender, trample
When Elder Land Wurm blocks, it loses defender.
card.flavor: Sometimes it's best to let sleeping dragons lie.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Another effect can give Elder Land Wurm defender after it has lost it. Blocking again will cause it to lose that instance of defender too.

card.name: El-Hajjâj
card.ability: Whenever El-Hajjâj deals damage, you gain that much life.

card.name: Elven Riders
card.ability: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
card.flavor:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven proverb
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

card.name: Elvish Archers
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade"

card.name: Energy Flux
card.ability: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

card.name: Energy Tap
card.ability: Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, add {X} to your mana pool, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

card.name: Erg Raiders
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if Erg Raiders didn't attack this turn, Erg Raiders deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

card.name: Erosion
card.ability:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.

card.name: Eternal Warrior
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.
card.flavor: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

card.name: Evil Presence
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The enchanted land loses its existing land types and any abilities printed on it. It now has the land type Swamp and has the ability "{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool." Evil Presence doesn't change the enchanted land's name or whether it's legendary, basic, or snow.

card.name: Eye for an Eye
card.ability: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
2/1/2009 : Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

card.name: Fear
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

card.name: Feedback
card.ability:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

card.name: Fellwar Stone
card.ability: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
card.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, called the Pretender
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
10/4/2004 : This works even if the opponent's lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.
10/4/2004 : The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
10/1/2009 : The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can't be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.
10/1/2009 : Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.
10/1/2009 : When determining what colors of mana your opponents' lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands' mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.
10/1/2009 : Fellwar Stone doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your opponents' lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

card.name: Fire Elemental
card.flavor: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

card.name: Fireball
card.ability:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.
12/1/2004 : If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
5/1/2009 : You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
10/1/2009 : Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
10/1/2009 : You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

card.name: Firebreathing
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"And topples round the dreary west
A looming bastion fringed with fire."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
10/1/2009 : The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

card.name: Fissure
card.ability: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?"
—Plato

card.name: Flashfires
card.ability: Destroy all Plains.

card.name: Flight
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

card.name: Flood
card.ability: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
card.flavor:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Fog
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

card.name: Force of Nature
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

card.name: Fortified Area
card.ability: Wall creatures you control get +1/+0 and have banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

card.name: Frozen Shade
card.ability: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"There are some qualities, some incorporate things, / That have a double life, which thus is made / A type of twin entity which springs / From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

card.name: Fungusaur
card.ability: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

card.name: Gaea's Liege
card.ability:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When being declared as an attacker, use the "not attacking" power and toughness. It only changes after declaration is complete.
9/25/2006 : The activated ability doesn't affect whether the land is basic or not. It overwrites any other land types. Being a Forest gives the affected land the ability "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

card.name: Gaseous Form
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
" . . . And gives to airy nothing
A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream

card.name: Ghost Ship
card.ability:
Flying
{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
card.flavor:
"That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."
—Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Giant Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
card.flavor:
"O it is excellent
To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous
To use it like a giant."
—William Shakespeare, Measure for Measure

card.name: Giant Tortoise
card.ability: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

card.name: Glasses of Urza
card.ability: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

card.name: Gloom
card.ability:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
10/4/2004 : The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
10/4/2004 : The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.

card.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
card.ability: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks"
"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.
8/15/2010 : For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade's ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

card.name: Goblin King
card.ability: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
card.flavor: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

card.name: Goblin Rock Sled
card.ability:
Trample
Goblin Rock Sled doesn't untap during your untap step if it attacked during your last turn.
Goblin Rock Sled can't attack unless defending player controls a Mountain.

card.name: Grapeshot Catapult
card.ability: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.

card.name: Gray Ogre
card.flavor: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, preferring to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

card.name: Greed
card.ability: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. . . . And there is no greater disaster than greed."
—Tao Tê Ching 46

card.name: Green Mana Battery
card.ability:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Green Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Green Mana Battery: Add {G} to your mana pool, then add an additional {G} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

card.name: Green Ward
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green. This effect doesn't remove Green Ward.

card.name: Grizzly Bears
card.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

card.name: Healing Salve
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Helm of Chatzuk
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Hill Giant
card.flavor: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

card.name: Holy Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Holy Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

card.name: Howl from Beyond
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Howling Mine
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
10/4/2004 : It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
10/4/2004 : The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
4/15/2013 : The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

card.name: Hurkyl's Recall
card.ability: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.
card.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
10/4/2004 : It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

card.name: Hurloon Minotaur
card.flavor: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

card.name: Hurr Jackal
card.ability: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

card.name: Hurricane
card.ability: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Hypnotic Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
card.flavor:
". . . There was no trace
Of aught on that illumined face . . . ."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

card.name: Immolation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.

card.name: Inferno
card.ability: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames."
—Mairsil, called the Pretender

card.name: Instill Energy
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
10/4/2004 : Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.
8/1/2005 : Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

card.name: Iron Star
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Ironclaw Orcs
card.ability: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
card.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

card.name: Ironroot Treefolk
card.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

card.name: Island Fish Jasconius
card.ability:
Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius.
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep.  You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

card.name: Island Sanctuary
card.ability: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
10/4/2004 : If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Since the draw is replaced, you can't use the same draw to do other things.

card.name: Ivory Cup
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Ivory Tower
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.
card.flavor: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you have four or fewer cards in your hand when Ivory Tower's ability resolves, the ability has no effect.

card.name: Jade Monolith
card.ability: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

card.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

card.name: Jayemdae Tome
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

card.name: Jump
card.ability: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

card.name: Junún Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

card.name: Karma
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

card.name: Keldon Warlord
card.ability: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a Characteristic-Defining Ability. It checks the number of non-Wall creatures you control continuously, and applies in all zones. It is never "locked in".

card.name: Killer Bees
card.ability:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

card.name: Kismet
card.ability: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
2/1/2007 : It affects all opponents.
2/1/2007 : Does not affect cards that phase in.

card.name: Kormus Bell
card.ability: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The lands are both lands and creatures at the same time. They are affected by anything that affects either permanent type.
10/4/2004 : It affects Swamps controlled by any and all players.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Land Leeches
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor:
"The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."
—Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Land Tax
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/15/2006 : You can fetch any of the Snow-Covered lands, since they all also have the supertype Basic.
10/1/2009 : This ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
10/1/2009 : You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don't put any basic land cards into your hand.

card.name: Leviathan
card.ability:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

card.name: Ley Druid
card.ability: {T}: Untap target land.
card.flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power form the land and returning it when needed.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can't be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

card.name: Library of Leng
card.ability:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This effect has no effect on the cards being put into the graveyard from a library, because they are not "discarded".
10/4/2004 : You can't use the Library of Leng ability to place a discarded card on top of your library when you discard a card as a cost, because costs aren't effects.
10/4/2004 : The discard triggers anything else that triggers on discards.
10/4/2004 : You can look at a randomly discarded card before deciding where it goes.
10/4/2004 : The ability applies any time a spell or ability has you discard as part of its effect. It does not matter if you or your opponent control the spell or ability. The discard is forced because it is an effect.
10/4/2004 : If more than one card is discarded due to a single effect, the Library allows you to decide whether or not to use it on each of the cards. You get to decide the order the cards are placed on the library if more than one goes there.
10/4/2004 : Since the card goes directly to the library, the card is not revealed unless the spell or ability requiring the discard specifically says it is.
10/4/2004 : The ability replaces the normal discard action with a discard action that puts the card on the library instead of the graveyard.
10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Library of Leng onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

card.name: Lifeforce
card.ability: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

card.name: Lifelace
card.ability: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

card.name: Lifetap
card.ability: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Gives one life for each and every Forest tapped.
10/4/2004 : In multi-player games it affects all opponents.

card.name: Lightning Bolt
card.ability: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Living Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can cast it targeting your opponent's artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.
10/4/2004 : Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.

card.name: Living Lands
card.ability: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Hardened by their life in the haunted Llanowar Forest, these fierce beings are outcasts among elvenkind.

card.name: Lord of Atlantis
card.ability: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
card.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

card.name: Lord of the Pit
card.ability:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can select creatures with Protection from Black to be sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : If you have a creature, you must sacrifice it. The 7 damage can only be taken if no creature can be sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

card.name: Lost Soul
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor:
Her hand gently beckons,
she whispers your name—
But those who go with her
are never the same.

card.name: Lure
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
10/4/2004 : If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
10/4/2004 : The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

card.name: Magical Hack
card.ability: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
10/4/2004 : It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the words to change on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
10/4/2004 : Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
10/4/2004 : If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
10/4/2004 : It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

card.name: Magnetic Mountain
card.ability:
Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures he or she controls and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

card.name: Mahamoti Djinn
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

card.name: Mana Clash
card.ability: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Always affects the player and targets one of his or her opponents.
10/4/2004 : Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
10/4/2004 : This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

card.name: Mana Flare
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the land produces more than one color of mana at a single time, its controller chooses which of those types is produced by Mana Flare's ability.
10/4/2004 : The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
10/4/2004 : When used with lands that can produce multiple colors, Mana Flare produces one additional mana of the same color that was produced. It can't give a mana of a color that wasn't produced.
10/4/2004 : Only produces extra mana when land is tapped for mana, not when tapped by some other effect.
10/4/2004 : Mana Flare adds one of whatever color the land produces after applying any land type or color changing effects.
10/4/2004 : This is a triggered mana ability.
9/16/2007 : Does not copy any restrictions on the mana, such as with Mishra’s Workshop or Pillar of the Paruns.
9/16/2007 : Produces only one additional mana, regardless of how much was produced by tapping the land.

card.name: Mana Short
card.ability: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since this is an Instant, your opponent may use Instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of Instant spells and abilities.
10/4/2004 : If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
10/4/2004 : It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

card.name: Mana Vault
card.ability:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

card.name: Manabarbs
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
10/1/2009 : This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
10/1/2009 : The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.
10/1/2009 : If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.
10/1/2009 : On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

card.name: Marsh Gas
card.ability: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."
—Keevy Bogsbury

card.name: Marsh Viper
card.ability: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
card.flavor:
"All we had left were their black and bloated bodies."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Meekstone
card.ability: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

card.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
card.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

card.name: Mesa Pegasus
card.ability: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Millstone
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
10/4/2004 : It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
10/4/2004 : Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

card.name: Mind Bomb
card.ability: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

card.name: Mind Twist
card.ability: Target player discards X cards at random.

card.name: Mishra's Factory
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
